name: James Yin
introduction: I am a seasoned leader and strategist with over 20 years of experience in the Singapore Army, where I tackled complex challenges, led high-performing teams, and delivered tangible outcomes in various crises, disasters, and conflicts. I am also a certified sustainability professional with qualifications in integrating ESG, sustainable finance, and ESG reporting standards. I am a Futures Fellow at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy Executive Education, Affiliate Faculty of the Singapore Management University and an SID Accredited Director. At V-Plus Agritech, a circular agriculture company that aims to reduce food waste, carbon emissions, and water consumption, I am on a mission to drive climate action and create environmental and social impact.
top_3_advice: Be hungry to learn. New policies, standards, and regulations are being rolled out regularly. It takes effort to understand new innovations and business concepts that can address climate change as well. You need to keep learning in order to be ready and competent to contribute to climate action.

Network extensively. Climate action is about transforming a broken global system. It's like a giant jigsaw puzzle that takes networking to understand how things work. Eventually, somebody out there will have the answer you are looking for.
Persistence and resilience matter. Climate action is not for the faint-hearted. It's a marathon, not a sprint with quick results.
how_can_help: I am happy to help TMI users through sharing on the following topics: 1. My experiences as a sustainability startup founder. 2. My expertise in sustainable agritech (urban farming, aquaponics, hydroponics etc.) 3. My journey in making a career switch from the military into sustainability. 4. My network to help point people in the right direction to get resources and collaborate, etc.
sustainability_journey: From soldier to sustainability champion ‚òòÔ∏è: 3 years ago, I made a bold career move. After serving my country in a career as a military officer, I traded my green uniform for a greener mission: building a more sustainable future. Farming or entrepreneurship were never my aspirations. However, inspired by Bob Buford's 'Half-Time', I simply wanted the second half of my career to be impactful, just like the first. Re-visiting my Ikigai, I figured that my focus would be sustainability! This is because the biggest need for the next few decades is saving the üåé from ourselves.
sustainable_actions: As a company on a sustainability mission, I personally take charge of all aspects of sustainability. This includes renewable energy & efficiency initiatives, like using agrovoltaics and DC (direct current) pumps in system design, to participating in the CDL Queen Bee Decarbonisation Programme, to making climate disclosure.
challenges_overcome: I faced a lack of conviction from internal stakeholders that sustainability is not just a cost centre, but a competitive advantage. A lot of convincing was required. But in the end, I just put my money where my mouth is.
most_proud_of: Our company, V-Plus Agritech, is a trailblazer amongst SMEs by being the first cohort to graduate from the CDL Queen Bee Decarbonisation Programme. We're also probably the first agritech SME to make climate disclosure.
